page.title: 20Halewood - Area of Contrast.
page.content:
When the two schools undertaking this survey got together we found that there were startling contrasts in the township of Halewood. The area was found to be divided into two vastly differing social areas. To the north of the railway the residential areas were settled and life was "normal". To the south of the railway there were found to be many difficulties, these being extremely high unemployment, a very large proportion of single parent families, much vandalism, litter strewn roads and a fairly high crime rate. The schools also have a high incidence of vandalism and forced entry.
All the work for this survey was conducted by the children and staff of Roseheath and the Church of England Schools, Halewood.
